intro: Mammillaria laui subsp. dasyacantha, commonly known as the dense-spined mammillaria, is a small, globular cactus native to Mexico. It features a compact, rounded stem covered in numerous short, white spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Its unique spination and compact growth make it a popular choice for rock gardens and cactus collections.
